task_summary: Pick up the red object from the table using the robot arm by detecting, approaching, and grasping.

task_long_description.overview: The scene shows a robot arm and a tabletop with a red cylindrical object and a blue tray. The robot's goal is to pick up the red object from the table. The task progresses through perception, approach, grasp, and lifting phases using visual and force feedback to ensure reliable execution with moderate precision. The system adapts if the red object is not immediately visible by rescanning before proceeding to manipulation steps.
preconditions: Red object is located and reachable on the table surface.
Robot gripper is free and operable.
Scene is unobstructed and lighting sufficient for visual detection.
stepwise_plan: Check if the red object is visible.
If not visible, scan to locate the red object.
Detect and localize the red object.
Open gripper in preparation for grasping.
Move arm above the red object.
Approach and align to the red object with moderate precision.
Lower gripper until contact with the object is detected.
Close gripper to secure the red object.
Verify the red object is held.
Lift the red object from the table surface.
success_criteria: Red object is detected and picked up securely.
Gripper successfully encloses and lifts the red object.
Object remains held and is above the table at task end.
failure_and_recovery: Failure to see object: Re-scan area up to three times.
Failure to detect object: Abort grasp sequence.
Unstable grasp: Retry or abort after drop.
task_long_description.termination: Task terminates after the red object is lifted and held securely above the table for a short duration.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: pick up the red object from the table

node_specs.description: Checks whether the red object is visible to the camera
Scans the workspace to locate the red object if not yet visible
Performs object detection and localization for the red object
Opens the gripper to a moderate width in preparation for grasp
Moves the gripper above the red object by 5cm
Approaches and aligns the gripper to the red object with moderate precision
Lowers the gripper until contact with the red object is detected
Closes the gripper with low force to grasp the red object
Checks that the red object is held in the gripper
Waits briefly to confirm the lift

failure_modes: Red object not visible due to occlusion or lighting
Red object position not detected correctly
Object slips or is not stably grasped
recovery_strategy: Retry scanning for the object up to three times
Attempt regrasp if object not held (not implemented here)
assumptions: Instruction and frames are consistent: the red object is always present on the table and there is no visible evidence of it being moved in this episode.
No placing action is present as the full pick-and-place sequence is not visible (lifting only); the task stops after picking up.

expected_success_criteria: Object lifted and held above table.
